Reviews.Title: “Great time at Treetops”
Reviews.Author: Peter_and_Lisa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Treetops for 4 nights after walking in with no reservation. We took the kitchenette suite. It was clean with a comfortable bed and plenty of room for the two of us. The room had A/C (a must in July!) and a TV. We enjoyed our stay as we were close to the beach and the main drag. The staff was friendly and helpful and housekeeping was prompt and competent. The hotel is quiet and comfortable at a reasonable price. There was construction going on next door but only during the day and the hotel discounted our rooms because of the "noise". We never heard a thing. This was my second stay and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the money”
Reviews.Author: kulak
Reviews.Content: The good things about Tree Tops: (1) Location. (2) Friendly, hassle-free front desk. (3) Price & availability. (4) Generally clean & pleasant. Not quite as good: (1) Construction was right next door to us during our stay, and I suspect it will be going on for months. (I was not told of this when I booked it.) This was noisy, including at night, and spoiled the ocean-side view a bit. (Although there might not be any such view once the construction is over.) (2) They asked that we limit use of toilet paper in the toilet. Never was quite sure what was allowed there. Words were something like "do not fill toilet with toilet paper". Many bathrooms in PDC want the TP to go in a trash can, not the toilet. My wife and kids liked the place, and thought I did a fine job of picking the hotel. I did not even try to book a hotel unitl mid-February. Availability was a problem by then. Based on comparison shopping on the internet, and using on-line booking agents, Tree Tops is a pretty good bargain. For that price, I can't complain. I got the booking through Worldlinks Travel, which was pretty hassle-free. Non-hotel observations on PDC generally. Places tend to not take credit cards, even if they say they do on the menu or if you ask directly. They want cash. One even said our card was "denied", when I know it wasn't. Beware of every single transaction, even at what look like more upscale restaurants. They don't have the bottle of wine you ordered, and neglect to tell you the substitute costs $13 more. Those "free drinks" they offered only come free if you order a meal over $20 (when most cost less than that) which they only tell you after you got the drinks and after you ordered. Etc. There is no such thing as a hassle-free transaction. The exception being the booking of Tree Tops through Worldlinks Travel, like I did.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: princessW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Treetops for 5 nights, early in February, and we were very pleased. It was our first time in PDC. Yes, our room was "no frills", but it was clean and we had a great shower. We also had a mini fridge and coffee maker. On our first morning there, we had breakfast at a cafe just around the corner, on Avenue 5. We bought a pound of coffee there and they ground it up for us and gave us filters. The girls at the front desk, Amitra and Marchella were really sweet. They don't have a safe in the rooms, but there is one at the front desk, which we felt comfortaable to use the whole time we were there. The best thing about Treetops is the location. You are steps from the beach in one direction and steps from the main drag in the other. Yet, when you went to your room, you never heard a thing, so we always got a good night sleep. The stone path to the rooms is a little tough, especially when you first arrive and wheel your luggage to your room. Yes, the pool is just about useless, and the bar isn't worth your time, but you have all the bars that you would ever want right around the corner. Because the rooms are situated on either side of the pathway, beyond the front desk, there is only one entrance to the hotel. A night guard is on duty after 11pm. My husband is a pretty paranoid person, but even he felt safe here. We stayed during Super Bowl, and Treeetops did have a Super Bowl party in the bar. All in all, we met some great people, had the best time, and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: neilhernan
Reviews.Content: Four couples stayed in Treetops in late February 2007. We were all interested in a clean, comfortable place to stay rather than a plush hotel room and got exactly what we were expecting. At $105 per night, we all thought this was an excellent buy and would come back again. Our philosophy is that all we do in the rooms is sleep so we are looking for cleanliness and security. Treetops fit the bill. They have an attached bar where we all met for happy hour before going out on the town.

Reviews.Title: “Good location Bad exchange rate”
Reviews.Author: WithFamilyWillTravel
Reviews.Content: Our family (with 6 and 9 year old children) stayed in one of the kitchenette suites for 5 nights. Location was great: beach a half block away and 5th Avenue a half block the other way. The pool was too small to be useful. Rooms were clean, no bugs, but a bit worn. Bed was softer than Mexican standard - comfy. Staff was friendly and the maid did great towel art. The latches on all the windows did not work but it seemed safe enough - just use the hotel safe (at the front desk). Watch the posted rates! They quote in U$ but if you pay by credit card they convert to Pesos at an exchange rate 10% worse than the street rate - effectively a 10% surcharge for not paying in U$ cash!

Reviews.Title: “Treetops is Tops!”
Reviews.Author: JimSChicago_Illinois
Reviews.Content: Treetops is a lovely hotel just off the main drag, a half block from the ocean and just up the street the other way is a marvelous Mayan restaurant. Our room, set back in the jungle garden by the cenote, was large and very comfortable. In the evening, the open window and ceiling fan made sleeping most pleasant. We had no need for the A/C. Despite the nightly goings on on Fifth Avenue, it was nice and quiet in our room. The staff was friendly and courteous. The towel origami with flower petals was a pleasant surprise as well. The parrot who would sing "Ay! Ay! No llores" every morning was also an amusing diversion. All in all, Treetops was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Treetops”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Treetops in March 2006 with my friend. Our room was simple-no tv, no phone, no clock. But the room was clean and well-kept. Ants crept under the door from outside, but that is to be expected in a warm climate like Playa. We paid $94.00/night, and that price is reasonable. The staff is polite. The courtyard of the hotel is pleasant, and the shade that it provides keeps your room cool during the day-so it didn't matter that they requested us to turn off the air conditioner while we were out. Great location-just steps from the beach and right in the middle of 5th street, which is the main drag with all the restaurants, shops, and bars. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Forgotten reservations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After emailing back and forth several times about the exact date of our arrival, I thought they finally had it right; of course we show up and there are no reservations for us at all. They had a room that night so we stayed, and they offered to accomodate us by moving us every few days to a different room, but this was not our idea of a relaxing vacation so we found another hotel for the remainder of our stay. Tree Tops was clean and quiet, but the pool was lacking; it's under a gazebo and gets no sun. I never saw anyone in or around it. There are better bargains to be had in PDC.

Reviews.Title: “5 great days at Treetops”
Reviews.Author: Regular_site_user
Reviews.Content: We had 5 great days at Treetops during the Easter holidays. It's really well located, close to the beach and 5th Avenue, and very well managed by the very pleasant owners and their staff. The rooms have good sized fridges (really useful), balconies, and the trees and cenote in the centre of the hotel are really pretty, and a good place to come to avoid the heat of the day. The pool is under cover which makes it ideal for anyone needing to avoid the midday sun. They also have good-sized safety deposit boxes in reception for no extra charge. The only negative really was the noise of the aircon units which are on the balcony walls, which make sitting on the balconies in the evenings difficult. Especially when some guests leave theirs switched on when they go out. We also really enjoyed the food, the breakfast was excellent, and we had one of the best dinners during our stay. The bar is nice, and they make good cocktails, but tend to leave the TV on which we didn't appreciate.

Reviews.Title: “every cloud has a silver lining”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Treetops hotel for a night during my trip around Mexico in October this year, and i thought it was a beautiful little hotel at very cheap prices. Our room was £20 for the night, and although the bed was smaller than desired..the feel of the hotel (surrounded in jungle, with a quaint swimming pool just outside) made a lasting impression. In the wet however mostiquoes were rife due to the damp and the forest, and the accomodation was so that they found it quite easy to make their way into your room and feast on you. I picked up over 10 bites on a single night there. Overall tho, buy some repellant, take a camara and appreciate this cute little hotel situated right on one of the nicest beaches in the Carribean

Reviews.Title: “Treetops, did not live up to reviews.”
Reviews.Author: mritalvr
Reviews.Content: When planning our honeymoon to the Yucatan Peninsula, we decided to stay at several spots along the coast. One of our stops was Treetops. I had read many good reviews and checked out their website and it looked great. When we arrived, there was no record of our reservation but they had a room available so we stayed. There was a pool with a bar that was not working, which looked very nice on the internet, but not in person. The room was very small and stuffy and had a musty smell. The only nice thing was that it was literally up in the Treetops and the town was fun.

Reviews.Title: “No frills economy”
Reviews.Author: C-monkey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Treetops for 4 nights mid-April 2004. Not bad but not great. Husband & I were looking for a clean comfy room for sleep in between diving. The staff was friendly & helpful. The room was clean but very sparse in accomodations. The a/c did work great. The large mini-fridge was convenient. The tv was tiny with no remote control for late night channel surfing. The only mirror was tiny & high up-- I'm a short female so that was inconvenient. The water pressure wasn't good at all & we didnt have hot water on our last night/morning. The bathroom windows were not covered & we were at ground level so it was weird having to hang towels up for privacy. They were very stingy about towels. The pool was not good-- completely covered and cold cold water! Very close to the public beach though so just walk on down & grab a chair or sqaure of sand. Hotel very conveniently located downtown-- all restaruants & shopping right there. DIVING: best dive shop in town located directly across the street- DIVE MIKE. Excellent guides, great service. Held our gear each night & very accomodating when the harbor was closed due to rough sea. Made us very comfortable on our 1st cenote dives. Would probably try a different hotel- but will always use Dive Mike.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but better bargains around”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the fan-only palapa for $35 a night during the off season (June). The bungalow was small, but adequate. The staff was friendly, and maid service was prompt and thorough. However, there was no breakfast included in the price (as advertised on the Treetops website), and there were much better bargains in town, including air-conditioned rooms with two beds for $25 per night.

HotelInfo.Name: Treetops
HotelInfo.Address: Calle 8 S/N, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
